tb.Selector.name: tb.Selector

params.name: pDomNode
params.description: - optional, the DOM node in which to search

return.description:
- the twoBirds instance you just created

twoBirds selector constructor

CAUTION: you may use this class directly if you know what you are doing,
but the correct syntax for call is simply:

example:
tb( pSelector )
       .whateverChainedMethod(); // etc.

HINT: tb() works as a selector, new tb() instanciates a twoBirds instance from a class.

classitems.name: set

params.name: pValue
params.description: - any kind of value associated with the key

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance or tB instance - for chaining

set() method

sets an instance property

example:
var a = new tb(...); // create a tB instance
a.set( 'x': 42 );

classitems.name: get

return.description:
any value stored in property, or undefined

get() method

get an instance property

example:
var a = new tb(...); // create a tB instance
    a.get( 'x' );

params.name: pHandler
params.description: - the function to be added to the handler array

.on() method

adds a handler to a twoBirds instance or a tb.Selector result set

params.name: pHandler
params.description: - the function to be added to the handler array

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance or tB instance - for chaining

.one() method

adds a handler to a twoBirds instance or a tb.Selector result set,
to be called only once when the event fires
afterwards the handler is deleted from the event handler list

params.name: pHandler
params.description: - the function to be added to the handler array

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance or tB instance - for chaining

.off() method

removes a handler from a twoBirds instance or a tb.Selector result set
afterwards the handler is deleted from the event handler list

- tb.Selector instance - for chaining

.parents() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get all parent tb objects
- check them against the filter param pSelector
- return them as a TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance - for chaining

.parent() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get closest parent tb object
- check all of them against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance - for chaining

.descendants() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get all descendants of tb object
- check them against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

params.name: pLocalOnly
params.description: - only local children of given tb instance(s)

return.description:
- tb.Selector instance - for chaining

.children() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get all direct children of tb object
- check them against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

next() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get the direct following sibling of tb instance
- check it against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

prev() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get the direct previous sibling of tb instance
- check it against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

first() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get the first child of the tb object parent
- check it against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

last() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- get the last child of the tb object parent
- check it against the filter param pSelector
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- TbSelector elements in a plain array

toArray() method

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

filter() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- check them against the filter param pParam
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

not() method

for each this[0...n] or this as tb() instance,
- check them against pSelector and remove all that match
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

- tb.Selector instance (maybe empty) - for chaining

add() method

add elements to current result set
- return TbSelector result set (unique)

classitems.description:
- will replace all matching {namespace1.namespace2.etc} occurrences with values from pParse object
 - if typeof pWhat is object or array, it will be done with all strings contained therein and the original pWhat returned
classitems.name: tb.parse

params.name: pWhat
params.description: string, object or array to parse recursively

params.name: pParse
params.description: any number of hash objects containing replacement key/value pairs

return.description: pWhat parsed

example:
tb.parse( "{a} test test", { a: 'done' } )
     // "done test test"

tb.parse( [ "{a} test test" ], { a: 'done' } )
     // ["done test test"]

tb.parse( [ "{a} test test", "{b} test test" ], { a: 'done', b: 'processed' } )
     // ["done test test", "processed test test"]

tb.parse( [ "{a} test test", "{b} test test", { g: "another {silly} test" } ], { a: 'done', b: 'processed', silly: 'not so silly' } )
     // ["done test test", "processed test test", Object { g="another not so silly test"}]

tb.parse( { a: "{a} test test", b: "{b} test test", c: [ "another {silly} test" ] }, { a: 'done', b: 'processed', silly: 'not so silly' } )
     // Object { a="done test test",  b="processed test test",  c=[ "another not so silly test" ] }

classitems.name: tb.require

params.name: pCallback
params.description: optional callback after all loading is done

return.description: - Promise/A+ compliant promise object

params.name: pOptions
params.description: a hash object containing these options:

props.name: params
props.description: - a hash object containing the parameters to post

props.name: method
props.description: - (string, optional, defaults to 'POST') the XHR method

props.name: headers
props.description: - a hash object containing additional XHR headers

props.name: success
props.description: - the function to call with the request result

props.name: error
props.description: - the function to call if request status not in 200...299

props.name: statechange
props.description: - the function to call when readyState changes

props.name: timeout
cachable
props.description: - defaults to true, indicates whether or not to include a unique id in URL

props.name: async
props.description: - whether or not to make an asynchronous request

return.description: - a Promise/A+ compliant promise object

params.name: pStopit
params.description: - indicating whether to stop event handling

return.description:
- true if event handling stopped, else false

stops event handling
